definition: to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
obstructed/to fail/to oppress/to repress/to lower the tone/to bend back/to dampen

sentences.english: This film, a favorite with audiences, may be the most upbeat of the nominees.
sentences.chinese: 這部廣受觀衆歡迎的影片，可能力挫羣雄。

sentences.english: Bush to win a dreaded " Foot in Mouth" award on Tuesday from the Plain English campaign.
sentences.chinese: 麥克拉倫力挫美國總統布什，贏得這一“殊榮”。

sentences.english: Traders warned that further advances in the dollar would push down the price of oil.
sentences.chinese: 交易員提醒說，美元進一步走高會力挫石油價格。

definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to fight with all one's might
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
